Terrain.Name: Coastal Water
Terrain.Description: The coastal salt water beneath you surrounds the shores of the island, acting as a buffer between the beaches and the deep ocean water. Many commercial vessels stick to these waters where it is safe, although the trip is longer than sailing over the open sea. Schools of fish are a common sight.

Terrain.Name: Deep Ocean Water
Terrain.Description: Deep ocean water stretches off into the distance in all directions. The water is very deep here, reaching about a hundred free before it finds the bottom. Marine trenches can extend even farther beyond that. Larger marine life lives here in the deep waters away from the shore, including animals such as whales to giant squid.

Terrain.Name: Frozen River
Terrain.Description: The cold temperatures have frozen this river solid. It is strong enough to walk on without much risk of it breaking. It is possible that, in some areas, the water has frozen all the way through, though it is more likely that a current still flows beneath the surface.

Terrain.Name: River
Terrain.Description: The waters of the river beneath are the lifeblood of the world, meandering through the countryside until they reach the ocean. Rivers vary wildly in their makeup, ranging from small creeks to powerful currents. A variety of fish live in the water and an assortment of wildlife often lives nearby.

Terrain.Name: Lake
Terrain.Description: The lakes of the world are generally calm bodies of water, occasionally interrupted by rivers carrying new water. Many fish too large to live in the rivers find home in the waters of the various lakes. The deeper waters can become quite dark, however, and legends exist of terrible monsters that live beneath the calm water.

Terrain.Name: Deep Lake
Terrain.Description: The lakes of the world are generally calm bodies of water, occasionally interrupted by rivers carrying new water. Many fish too large to live in the rivers find home in the waters of the various lakes. The deeper waters can become quite dark, however, and legends exist of terrible monsters that live beneath the calm water.

Terrain.Name: Hills
Terrain.Description: Rolling hills are scattered about the land, often preceding large mountain ranges. They are usually devoid of most life, supporting only stray grass and shrubs. Passage through the more rugged hills can be quite arduous.

Terrain.Name: Mountains
Terrain.Description: Mountains are rugged terrain, sporting cliffs, ravines, crevices, and slopes. Rocks and gravel cover the landscape, leaving little room for trees or even grass to grow. The going is very dangerous, as a single slip could lead to a frighteningly long drop over the edge of a cliff.

Terrain.Name: Mountain Peak
Terrain.Description: These mountainous peaks are the tallest points in the world. They reach into the clouds, razor sharp mountain ranges cutting into the sky. A fall from one of these pinnacles of the world would mean certain death.

Terrain.Name: Volcano
Terrain.Description: The result of great tectonic movements, this ancient mountain has turned into a magma-spewing volcano. The temperature rises dramatically, strong enough to burn flesh and melt soft metal.

Terrain.Name: Snowy Mountains
Terrain.Description: Mountains are rugged terrain, sporting cliffs, ravines, crevices, and slopes. Rocks and gravel cover the landscape, leaving little room for trees or even grass to grow. The going is very dangerous, as a single slip could lead to a frighteningly long drop over the edge of a cliff.

Terrain.Name: Grasslands
Terrain.Description: Wild grass of varying height dominates the nearby landscape. Meadows of tall prairie grass are interspersed with patches of short, rugged vegetation. A wide diversity of wildlife grazes throughout the grasslands of the world, which make for excellent hunting ground.

Terrain.Name: Jungle
Terrain.Description: Dense vegetation obscures vision in all directions. The canopy traps a layer of moisture and heat from escaping, making the jungle feel like a tropical zone. Insects are numerous and very annoying, buzzing about randomly. The chatter of birds is a nearly constant background noise.

Terrain.Name: Dense Jungle
Terrain.Description: Dense vegetation obscures vision in all directions. The canopy traps a layer of moisture and heat from escaping, making the jungle feel like a tropical zone. Insects are numerous and very annoying, buzzing about randomly. The chatter of birds is a nearly constant background noise.

Terrain.Name: Deciduous Forest
Terrain.Description: You are in a deciduous forest, one whose trees turn colors in the autumn and fall to the ground during the winter months. The forest is home to a great variety of animals, often ranging from bears and foxes to birds and mice. Light occasionally trickles through the canopy of leaves, sometimes opening into wide meadows.

Terrain.Name: Thick Deciduous Forest
Terrain.Description: You are in a dense deciduous forest, one whose trees turn colors in the autumn and fall to the ground during the winter months. The forest is home to a great variety of animals, often ranging from bears and foxes to birds and mice. Light occasionally trickles through the canopy of leaves, sometimes opening into wide meadows.

Terrain.Name: Evergreen Forest
Terrain.Description: You are in a coniferous forest made up primarily of evergreen trees; pines, cedars, and redwood trees. The needles discarded from the trees turn brown and form a dense blanket on the forest floor. The tall trees tend to block much of the sunlight and create a cool environment.

Terrain.Name: Thick Evergreen Forest
Terrain.Description: You are in a dense coniferous forest made up primarily of evergreen trees; pines, cedars, and redwood trees. The needles discarded from the trees turn brown and form a dense blanket on the forest floor. The tall trees tend to block much of the sunlight and create a cool environment.

Terrain.Name: Plains
Terrain.Description: The open plains are wide expanses of grassland, although not quite as lush or tall. There are very few trees scattered about the landscape and only a small number of hills interrupt the otherwise placid horizon. Wildlife is fairly sparse in this region, only to be discovered in small patches where the vegetation is more fertile.

Terrain.Name: Desert
Terrain.Description: The desert is a harsh region that experiences hot days and frigid nights. A nearly constant wind blows through the region, stirring up and building up sand dunes. Very little life can be found here, and that which can is dangerous; namely scorpions and snakes.

Terrain.Name: Oasis
Terrain.Description: The desert is a harsh region that experiences hot days and frigid nights. A nearly constant wind blows through the region, stirring up and building up sand dunes. This oasis provides some of the desperately needed water for those who live in the desert, and as a result is often the home to many animals.

Terrain.Name: Sand Dunes
Terrain.Description: This sand dune is a large collection of sand resulting from the sometimes fierce winds that blow through the desert. It provides you with a vantage point from which you can see for several miles, but it offers you no protection from the wind or the elements.

Terrain.Name: Swamp
Terrain.Description: Swamps, marshes, and bogs are all treacherous places. They are densely packed with vegetation of all sorts, but are also the home to many insects carrying some nasty diseases. Furthermore, the ground is often water-logged and not always stable, providing for some treacherous footing.

Terrain.Name: Glacier
Terrain.Description: You are on a glacier, a massive expanse of frozen ice. The continual snow is packed onto the glacier, forming smaller, denser ice. These glaciers carve valley out of mountains and deform terrain where they pass. Only the toughest creatures can survive here.

Terrain.Name: Tundra
Terrain.Description: The tundra is a tract of land that is devoid of most tree life. The cold temperatures and short growing seasons mean that even grass has difficulties surviving here. The soil beneath your feet is generally frozen throughout the year.
